pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors

Class PermutationUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.PermutationUtils

  • public class PermutationUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that provides utilities for generating special permutations. Permutations themselves are just represented as int[] arrays saying. It is presumed that each such array is a permutation of the numbers from 1 to n, where n is the length of the array. This invariant could be enforced by making a Permutation class but this has not been considered necessary to date.
    Author:
    Dominic Widdows

      Returns dimension for real and complex vectors, or dimension / 64 for binary vectors.

    • Method Detail

      • getPermutationLength

        public static int getPermutationLength(VectorType vectorType,
                       int dimension)
        Returns dimension for real and complex vectors, or dimension / 64 for binary vectors.

      • getShiftPermutation

        public static int[] getShiftPermutation(VectorType vectorType,
                        int dimension,
                        int shift)
        Creates a shift permutation that can be applied to vectors of this type and dimension.
        Parameters:
        vectorType - necessary argument because binary vectors are only permuted in 64-bit chunks
        dimension - dimension of vectors to be permuted
        shift - number of places to shift the vector
        Returns:
        array of length given by getPermutationLength(pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.VectorType, int).
